reviews.title: Amazing customer service!
reviews.text: I booked a room here a few days back and sadly had to cancel. The cancellation policy had kicked-in in full and I emailed Luca (the owner of the Residence) to see if the fee could be waived. Luca was quick to respond and was very understanding. He dealt with the company I reserved the room with to explain that he was okay waiving the fee. This has made us want to go there ever more! We look forward to going there someday and update the review accordingly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two days pre-cruise and it was a perfect choice. We arrived by a shared taxi from Marco Polo airport to the Hilton Molino Stucky. The Residenza is next door (a residential part of the refurbished complex) and half-price. What can be better than waking up in a corner apartment overlooking the Giudecca canal to the waking traffic on the canal as well as greeting and bidding adieu to grand cruise ships and others sailing past. The apartment was cleaned daily and a fine continental breakfast (parma ham, bread, cream cheese, milk, cream, cereal, coffee and tea ) was available daily which we enjoyed at leisure. We shopped for fruit and tomatoes at a grocery along the Fondamente San Biagio after visiting the Il Redemptoe church. Giudecca island is a quiet retreat from the madness of Venice in tourist season and allows for a sense of Venetian life. A free shuttle from the Hilton next door to Zattere and San Marco is available at regular intervals. The Alilaguna line stops at the Hilton on the way to the cruise terminal so we were able to take advantage of that easily for 7 Euros each at the end of our stay. The staff were very kind and helpful and charged our iPhone and camera as we had forgotten our European adaptor. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We were having trouble finding accommodation in Venice in high season. Look no further than this lovely converted warehouse. This isn't the cheapest accommodation in Venice, but if you want to have an experience that will be remembered long after the price - stay here! It was incredibly hot and crowded when we arrived in Venice in July 2012, and our initial impression was that were too far from the action - how wrong we were. It is only a short boat shuttle trip from Residenza across to San Marco and all the tourist attractions, and at the end of a day battling crowds, wonderful to come to a relatively quiet area of Venice. Our apartment was on the top floor, so spacious, cool and beautifully furnished. A really smart well equiped kitchenette with everything you could ask for a delicious breakfast, allowed us to relax in the mornings watching the water traffic pass by. For dinner we sometimes opted to stay on the main island, but more often on Guidecca Island, because there are several lovely little restaurants in walking distance. Harry's bar is a must.
reviews.title: Enjoy the view

reviews.text: Stayed at Rezidence Grandi Vedute in July 2012 for two nights. The property is magnificent. It is an old warehouse meticulously and beautifully renovated into gorgeous apartments. The breakfast supplied for our apartment was great, consisted of continental plus bacon. The views over the canal were sensational, watching our cruise ship sail past was exciting as we could almost reach out and touch it. Luca was fabulous and nothing was too much trouble for him. The free 5-7 minute shuttle across the water to St Marks was easy. My family and I are extremely fussy travellers - definitely the opposite of backpackers - and we couldn't fault this apartment. If staying again in Venice I definitely wouldn't stay anywhere else now - I have been spoiled.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Grandi Vedute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a great experience at the Grandi Vedute apartments--the view was great, the unit spacious and comfortable,clean, well serviced each day, and breakfast was perfect--ti felt like a home away from home. For those of u that know Venice,u can really appreciate that statement.
reviews.title: Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in September for our honeymoon and arrived on my birthday. I was surprised with a bottle of prosecco in our apartment from Luca the manager. The apartment was lovely with fantastic views across the canal. It was great to have the use of the free shuttle bus next door. The place was ideal for us to stay as it allowed us to escape from the hoards of tourists at the end of the day. Very quiet and peaceful. Luca was very quick to respond to all emails and queries when booking and gave us lots of information about La Giudecca on arrival. We ate out at one of the recommended restaurants, Altanella and had the most amazing fish dishes. We loved Venice and will definately go back and stay here again.
reviews.title: Beautiful apartment with amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent 2 nights here and we couldn't fault the place. The hilton is right next door, and for an equivalent sized suite, you would pay 5 times the price. The bed, bathroom, kitchen and living area are well decorated and extremely comfortable. Our room also had a view right onto the canal, and although noisy, it was picture perfect. It's also nice being located away from the main tourist area (although all of Venice is touristy), and using the free hilton taxi across to san marco makes it a lot easier too.
reviews.title: Amazing property
Great space away from crowds
reviews.text: We couldn't fault this place and can't recommend it highly enough.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I and her parents recently stayed for two nights in this hidden gem of Venice. The location is on the island of Giudecca across the canal from the main parts of Venice. The views are probably the best in town and by being right next to the Hilton Molino Stuckey you have access to their free shuttle. This shuttle runs about every 20 mins and takes you to Zattere and San Marco Sqaure. The apartment was great with kitchen, breakfast items, air conditioning, etc. There are around 5-6 restaurants on the island itself that sit on the water and look at Venice. There are also a few small markets for fresh fruit and vegetables, but I would recommend going across the canal for any major grocery purchases. Venice is a very busy tourist area so it was simply great to come back home and relax with a bottle of wine and enjoy the great scenery. I would also highly recommend the sky lounge at the top of the Hilton as a great place for lunch or drinks at night with simply breathtaking views. Highly recommend this place. The vaporettos that are the water buses run 7 euro for one way trips and 24 hours passes are available for 20 euro, which is a great deal if you plan to visit a lot of places in Venice. Water taxi from train station to this hotel should cost roughly 60 euro if you want to avoid the crowded buses.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel with Spectacular views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and found the hotel, room and facilities fantastic. The staff were helpful and the free Hilton taxi to San Marco was a real bonus. The room was beautiful overlooking the canal, but a lot quieter then over on San Marco, as this was a bit too busy and noisy, it was nice to come back to the peace and quiet after the madness.
reviews.title: Amazing Apartment overlooking Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Better late than never, as they say... we stayed for two nights in April 2012. It was marvelous. We stayed in “Sandolino” which is a nicely appointed one-bedroom apartment. The accomodations were nice, particulary the stocked kitchen & espresso machine. If I were to nitpick I'd mention the bed was a bit stiff and the shower was tight. However, we absolutely loved staying on Guidecca. We much prefer the laid back feel of the residential island vs. the chaos and tourists in Venice. The free shuttle to Venice made seeing the sights a breeze. Luca, the manager, was welcoming and he kindly offered a restaurant recommendation, Ristorante Pizzeria Do Mori. It was fantastic. My favorite pizza in all of Italy.We also enjoyed dinner nearby at Trattori Al Cacciatori.
reviews.title: What a find!
I love it :)
reviews.text: I must say this hotel is special. Why? Because when you're there, you don't feel like in hotel. You feel like home, decor makes that all. Decor is so interesting, perfectly captures the atmosphere of Venice :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here back in September for 2 nights so this review is long overdue! First of all, we had train issues getting into Venice so we arrived much later than expected and were unable to call to inform Lucca that we would be running late. Nevertheless, we reached the place and had the bar next door call. He was very gracious and checked us in at 8pm. We had a surprise bottle of Prosecco awaiting us in the fridge which was the perfect way to welcome us to Venice! We ate down the hotel at Harry's and enjoyed the amazing views off Giudecca Island. The entire suite was so spacious...an entire room for seating and the mini-kitchen/dining and a separate bedroom. Also, the bathroom was by far one of the largest we stayed in from our entire trip. Having the kitchen stocked daily was a great help and we really felt at home. Also, the complimentary water taxi to St. Marks was very convenient as you can reach any part of Venice from there. If you stay at the Hilton Stucky next door, you would be paying at least 3x the rate and not get the wonderful service like you get from here. I would recommend this place to all my family and friends that are traveling to Venice.
reviews.title: Amazing place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a marvelous stay in Venice from 21st of October till 24th of October 2012. Location was great, very nice appartment with all commodities available and great view, free shuttle is an extra benefit! La Guidiecca is a peacefull oase in lively Venice!
reviews.title: Marvelous Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1st Class accommodation on the quieter Giudecca Island. Very comfortable room which was cleaned every day. There was an excellent breakfast selection provided in our apartment each day too. The apartment itself is ideally located on the Island with a free shuttle service right outside to take you across to the main Venice Island. The staff were very welcoming & helpful, providing free guides & maps to Venice & it's surrounds. I would highly recommend this accommodation for anyone who wants to experience the hustle & bustle of Venice but with the option of a quiet retreat each night.
reviews.title: Venice Guidetta Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is the best of both worlds; a much bigger space than you`d get in a hotel but with the convenience of a daily service. The apartment was clean and very comfortable; breakfast every day was great and there was more than enough. It was also nice to be able to take a pizza back for supper some nights rather than have to find somewhere to eat. Didn`t need to speak with anyone during our stay, but check in and out was friendly and efficient. A great (and quiet) location, away from the busy centre, but not too difficult to get to the main attractions; for Zattere or (once an hour) St Marco the Hilton shuttle (no checks - seems anyone can ride) is more convenient than the vaporetto. Watch out too for the strange sight of a giant cruise ship sailing past the window.
reviews.title: Better than a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you don`t have a water taxi (and personally I can think of better things to do with €100) do take the Alilaguna to/from the airport. It takes forever, but once you`re on it`s a single ride almost to the door; a much better bet than the bus and vaporetto, believe me!
reviews.title: Viewing Venice from Across the Canal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with our apartment , particularly with the service provided by an excellent employee, Eleonora Scarpa who went out of her way and was of invaluable assistance. It was very refreshing to be able to return to Giudecca on the ferry after a day in Venice proper and be able to have many wonderful restaurants, a grocery store, wine store, etc, within walking distance if you chose not to dine in Venice every evening.. Dining alfresco with an excellent view of Venice at night was enchanting. Being surrounded by water and able to see so many water vessels while in your room was a unique experience. This coupled with our time experiencing all of the wonders of Venice made for an enchanting vacation.
reviews.title: One of my best hotel experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was really a great discovery. You get a canal facing room for probably 1/5 of the price than at the Hilton next door. In addition, the rooms are very spacious, you have your own kitchen and everything is very clean. You can use the Hilton Shuttle boat to San Marco and if you don't behave like an idiot, you can sneak in to the Hilton's pool area. I would come back any time!
reviews.title: (Much too) Short Break in Venice

reviews.text: With the help of fellow trip advisors, and hours of reading all the helpful reviews the decision on accommodation was made. The Residenza Grandi Vedute offered something just a bit different to our normal choice and this "difference" was what made it so special!
reviews.title: Great hotel
